member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.TranslateLayer
member.summary: A UIElement that is child to Diagram and contains all its items. It allows to apply translation on all items without changing the diagram object. This is used for implementation of Diagram.Bounds, e.g. when Bounds = (20,20,40,40) Item at coordinate 20,20 must be rendered at Diagram coordinate 0,0.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.RoundRectangleTemplate
member.summary: Represents an ElementTemplate that draws round rectangle.
member.remarks: This class ensures that the round corners do not change during resizing which is visually better. The drawback is that the radius appears to be specified in DiagramViewMeasure units and therefore a given shape instance will look bad when the measure unit is not the one for which the shape was designed.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behaviors.BehaviorBase.SetMouseCursor(System.Windows.Point,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Invoked while the mouse is moved to let your application set the mouse cursor.
member.param: A Point structure that specifies the position of the mouse cursor.

true if the user is going to create, delete, modify or select a DiagramItem; false if mouse behavior is not considered; in this case the mouse pointer is set to a default cursor according to the background LaneGrid.
member.return: A member of the CursorHint enumeration.

member.remarks: This method is invoked first and it relies on the public StartDraw method implemented by derived behavior classes.

The last DiagramNode in the Path.

If true, the Path with minimal total weight is found, summing the Weight of links in the Path.
member.returns: A Path instance that represents the shortest Path found or null (Nothing in Visual Basic) if there is no Path connecting from and to.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ConnectionPoint
member.summary: This class represent a connection between an edge and a node in a graph. It decouples the DiagramLink class from the DiagramNode class, allowing edges to connect different types of nodes without knowing anything of their implementation details. Each DiagramLink objects contains two ConnectionPoint instances describing the connections at both ends of the link.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ConnectionPoint class between the specified node and link.
member.param: The node whose connection to a link is managed by this ConnectionPoint.
The link whose connection to a node is managed by this ConnectionPoint.
Specifies which end of the link is represented by this ConnectionPoint.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Commands.Command.Execute(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Carries out an action, usually changing the diagram in some way.
member.param: Specifies whether undo/redo is enabled. If undo is disabled, the command won't be saved in undo history and will never be called to undo or redo itself. In such case you might choose to skip some housekeeping operations such as saving state variables for later undo/redo.
member.remarks: Implement your action's logic here. You must not execute commands by calling this method - instead pass them to diagram's ExecuteCommand. ExecuteCommand calls Execute and if UndoEnabled is set to true, adds the command to the undo manager's history.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramItem.Clone(System.Boolean)

member.returns: The copy of this item.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Text should be rotated when the shape node is rotated.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the Image should be rotated when the shape node is rotated.
member.remarks: The image is clipped by the rotated shape outline, even if this property is set to false.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Utilities.PointInPolygon(System.Windows.Point[],System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Determines if the specified point is within the specified polygon.
member.remarks: It uses the classical polygon hit-testing algorithm: a horizontal ray starting at the point is extended infinitely rightwards and the number of polygon edges that intersect the ray are counted. If the number is odd, the point is inside the polygon.
member.returns: true if the point is inside the polygon, false if not.

member.summary: Determines if the specified point is within the smallest rectangle that encloses the specified polygon.
member.returns: true or false depending on whether the point is in the rect or not.

member.summary: Indicates a top-to-bottom direction.

member.summary: Indicates a bottom-to-top direction.

member.summary: Indicates a left-to-right direction.

member.summary: Indicates a right-to-left direction.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutBalance
member.summary: Specifies how to order child nodes in order to produce layouts with custom balance.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutBalance.Original
member.summary: Indicates that the child order should not be changed.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutBalance.Reversed
member.summary: Indicates that the child order should be reversed.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutBalance.LeftHeavy
member.summary: Indicates that the child nodes with most total children will be processed first, thus producing a left-heavy layout.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutBalance.RightHeavy
member.summary: Indicates that the child nodes with least total children will be processed first, thus producing a right-heavy layout.

member.summary: Contains settings for the TreeLayout class.

member.summary: Get or set the layout direction.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutInfo.LevelDistance
member.summary: Get or set the minimal distance between two adjacent tree levels.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutInfo.NodeDistance
member.summary: Get or set the minimal distance between to adjacent nodes in the same level.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutInfo.KeepRootPosition
member.summary: Get or set a flag, indicating whether the layout manager should preserve the position of the root node.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutInfo.Margins
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the top-left corner of the smallest rectangle containing the arranged tree and the top-left point of the document bounds.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutInfo.StretchFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the stretch factor in radial layouts.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutInfo.Balance
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the ordering of the child nodes in order to produce layouts with custom balance.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutInfo.EnableAssistants
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the "assistant" trait is regarded when performing the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutInfo.CompactAssistants
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the "assistant" trait is regarded when performing the layout.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutTraits
member.summary: Indicates item traits specific to tree layouts. Members of this enumeration can be used as keys in the DiagramItem.LayoutTraits hashtable.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.TreeLayoutTraits.Assistant
member.summary: If the LayoutTraits value associated with a node through this key is true, the CenterTreeLayout treats this node as an "assistant" during the arrangement. If the value is false or is not present, the node is treated as "subordinate". The associated value can also be of type AssistantType if it is required to specify the position of the assistant node relative to its parent.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.AssistantType
member.summary: Indicates the type of an assistant node in a tree.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.AssistantType.None
member.summary: The node is not an assistant.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.AssistantType.Normal
member.summary: The node is an assistant and its relative position is determined automatically by the layout.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.AssistantType.Left
member.summary: The node is an assistant and it is always positioned to the left of its parent.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.AssistantType.Right
member.summary: The node is an assistant and it is always positioned to the right of its parent.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.AssistantPosition
member.summary: Specifies the final position of an assistant node. Assistants with type left or right are always positioned to the left or right respectively. The position of the "normal" assistants depends on their index in the children list.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.AssistantPosition.Unspecified
member.summary: The node is not yet distributed.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.AssistantPosition.Left
member.summary: The node is distributed to the left of its parent.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.AssistantPosition.Right
member.summary: The node is distributed to the right of its parent.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutTraits.Layer
member.summary: The number associated with this key specifies the index of the layer the layout should attempt to place the node to. Specifying a negative number indicates a layer starting from the last. For example, -1 would indicate the last layer, -2 - the layer before the last, and so on.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LayeredLayoutInfo class.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets a the overall orientation of the arranged diagram.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.Direction
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the arranged diagram.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.LayerDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between layer axis lines.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.NodeDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between adjacent nodes in a layer.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.Margins
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between the top-left corner of the smallest rectangle containing the arranged diagram and the top-left point of the document bounds.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.SplitLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to split layers that are much wider than the other layers.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.SwapPairsIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to try to optimize crossings by performing sequential swapping of adjacent nodes in all levels.
member.remarks: Pair swapping requires substantial amount of time for large and semi-large graphs.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.LinksCompactFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how much to compact the outermost arrows.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.TimeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a time-out value for the path-finding part of the layered layout algorithm.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.EnableCustomLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the layered layout will honor the LayeredLayoutTraits.Layer flags.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.Statistics
member.summary: Gets layout-specific information about the nodes and links participating in the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayoutInfo.EnforceLinkFlow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the layout will force all links to go in the same direction. If the supplied graph has cycles, it will be made acyclic prior the layout.
member.remarks: EnableCustomLayers and SplitLayers are ignored if this property is set to true.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayout.AssignCoordinates
member.summary: Assigns nodes positions using the precalculated grid positions of the nodes within all layers. See the paper "A Fast Layout Algorithm for k-Level Graphs", by Christoph Buchheim, Michael Junger and Sebastian Leipert

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayout.Apply
member.summary: Assigns nodes positions using the precalculated grid positions of the nodes within all layers.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayout.Layout
member.summary: Move nodes to their barycenters, according to their priority but doing so without any node swapping (i.e. the nodes' order remains the same).

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayout.Compact
member.summary: Makes the dummy nodes at the beginning and at the end of each level closer to each other.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Layout.LayeredLayout.MinimizeCrossings
member.summary: Tries to minimize crossings across all levels.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.CascadeLayout
member.summary: Performs cascading layout on simple, connected graphs.
member.remarks: The cascade layout places vertices on a virtual grid and arranges edges orthogonally, such that if the source graph is planar it is guaranteed that all edges will have no more than two bends and will not intersect.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLinkState
member.summary: Contains a snapshot of the internal state of a DiagramLink. Instances of this class are used to store the state of links for later undo or redo operations. If you derive from DiagramLink and need to implement undo support for the additional internal state defined by your class, do so by deriving from DiagramLinkState and overriding the DiagramLink.CreateState, DiagramLink.SaveState and DiagramLink.RestoreState methods.

member.summary: Anchor points are ignored.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AnchorPosition
member.summary: Specifies link anchoring relative to the origin or destination node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AnchorPosition.NoAnchor
member.summary: Indicates no anchoring.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AnchorPosition.HorzCenter
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AnchorPosition.VertCenter
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AnchorPosition.LeftCenter
member.summary: Indicates anchoring at the center of the left side of the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AnchorPosition.RightCenter
member.summary: Indicates anchoring at the center of the right side of the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AnchorPosition.TopCenter
member.summary: Indicates anchoring at the center of the top side of the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AnchorPosition.BottomCenter
member.summary: Indicates anchoring at the center of the bottom side of the node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.LinkCrossings
member.summary: Defines values that indicate how to render link intersection points.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.LinkCrossings.Straight
member.summary: No special indication for link intersection points.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.LinkCrossings.Arcs
member.summary: An arc is drawn at the intersection point of two links. It connects the segments of the link at higher Z position and goes over the link at lower Z.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.LinkCrossings.Cut
member.summary: The intersection segments of links at lower Z position are cut by links at higher Z position.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.LinkShape
member.summary: Specifies available link shapes.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.LinkShape.Bezier
member.summary: The segments of a link are Bezier curves.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.LinkShape.Polyline
member.summary: The segments of the link are straight lines.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.LinkShape.Cascading
member.summary: The segments of a link are horizontal and vertical lines, each one orthogonal to each adjacent segment.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.LinkTextStyle
member.summary: Specifies the position and alignment of links' labels.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.LinkTextStyle.Center
member.summary: The text is displayed horizontally above the middle link segment or control point, depending on whether there are an odd or even number of segments.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.LinkTextStyle.Rotate
member.summary: The text is displayed rotated at the same angle as the segment where the text is placed. A long enough segment from the middle link segments is chosen for that purpose.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.LinkTextStyle.OverLongestSegment
member.summary: The text follows the longest link segment and is displayed centered at the segment's middle point.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.LinkTextStyle.Follow
member.summary: The label text starts from the first point of the link and follows the path defined by the link segments. This style is useful for displaying long text.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachTo
member.summary: Specifies the type of attachment in a group.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachTo.FixedCorner
member.summary: Indicates attachment to a fixed corner of a node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachTo.Proportional
member.summary: Indicates proportional attachment to a node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachTo.LinkPoint
member.summary: Indicates attachment to an link's control point.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachTo.LinkSegment
member.summary: Indicates attachment to an link's segment.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachTo.LongestHSegment
member.summary: Indicates attachment to the longest horizontal segment of a link.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachTo.SideMiddle
member.summary: Indicates attachment to the middle of a side of a node's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachTo.AnchorToEdges
member.summary: Indicates attachment that is anchored to one or more sides of a node.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachToLink
member.summary: Specifies the possible ways to attach a node to a link.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachToLink.Point
member.summary: The node is attached to a fixed control point of the link.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachToLink.Segment
member.summary: The node is attached to a fixed segment of the link.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachToLink.LongestHSegment
member.summary: The node stays attached to the longest horizontal segment of the link.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachToNode
member.summary: Defines values specifying the possible ways to attach a node to another node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachToNode.TopLeft
member.summary: The node follows the top-left corner of the master node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachToNode.TopRight
member.summary: The node follows the top-right corner of the master node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachToNode.BottomLeft
member.summary: The node follows the bottom-left corner of the master node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachToNode.BottomRight
member.summary: The node follows the bottom-right corner of the master node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachToNode.TopCenter
member.summary: The node follows the top-center point of the master node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachToNode.MiddleRight
member.summary: The node follows the middle-right point of the master node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachToNode.BottomCenter
member.summary: The node follows the bottom-center point of the master node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AttachToNode.MiddleLeft
member.summary: The node follows the middle-left point of the master node.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AutoResize
member.summary: Defines in which directions automatic resizing can enlarge the diagram scrollable area.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AutoResize.None
member.summary: Do not enlarge the diagram area automatically.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AutoResize.RightAndDown
member.summary: Enlarge the diagram area to the right and down if an item is moved outside the boundaries in these directions.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AutoResize.AllDirections
member.summary: Enlarge the diagram area in any direction if an item is moved outside the boundaries.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior
member.summary: Defines values that specify how the component responds to actions performed by the user.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.Modify
member.summary: Objects can be selected and modified. New objects cannot be created.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.DrawShapes
member.summary: Drawing with the mouse creates ShapeNode instances.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.DrawLinks
member.summary: Drawing started over a node creates a DiagramLink. Otherwise a lasso rectangle is displayed allowing the selection of items.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.LinkShapes
member.summary: A mode that is suitable for creating flowcharts and process diagrams. Drawing over empty document area creates a ShapeNode instance. Drawing started over a node creates a DiagramLink.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.LinkTables
member.summary: A mode that is suitable for creating entity-relationship diagrams. Drawing over empty document area creates a TableNode instance. Drawing started over a node creates a DiagramLink.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.DrawTables
member.summary: Drawing with the mouse creates TableNode instances.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.DrawControls
member.summary: Drawing with the mouse creates a DiagramNodeAdapter object that wraps an instance of the DefaultControlType.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.LinkControls
member.summary: Drawing over empty document area creates a DiagramNodeAdapter instance. Drawing started over a node creates a DiagramLink.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.DoNothing
member.summary: The control ignores users actions with the mouse, but raises the appropriate mouse events. This mode allows applications to implement their own mouse-drawing behavior, disabling the WpfDiagram default response to users actions.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.Custom
member.summary: Specifies that user input should be handled by the BehaviorBase-derived object assigned to CustomBehavior.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.DrawContainers
member.summary: Drawing with the mouse creates ContainerNode instances.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.LinkContainers
member.summary: Drawing over empty document area creates a ContainerNode instance. Drawing started over a node creates a DiagramLink.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.Pan
member.summary: Dragging with the mouse pans the view. This requires that the Diagram is contained in a ScrollViewer.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.DrawTreeViews
member.summary: Drawing with the mouse creates TreeViewNode instances.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.LinkTreeViews
member.summary: Drawing over empty document area creates a TreeViewNode instance. Drawing started over a node creates a DiagramLink.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.DrawNodes
member.summary: Drawing with the mouse creates TemplatedNode instances.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Behavior.LinkNodes
member.summary: Drawing over empty document area creates a TemplatedNode instance. Drawing started over a node creates a DiagramLink.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CellFrameStyle
member.summary: Specifies the style of the cells' frame lines.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CellFrameStyle.None
member.summary: Table cells have no border.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CellFrameStyle.Simple
member.summary: The border of table cells is simple line.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CellFrameStyle.System3D
member.summary: The border has 3D look.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ColumnStyle
member.summary: Specifies how table columns' width is set.
member.remarks: Use the enumeration values to set the behavior of table columns, when the user resizes the table.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ColumnStyle.FixedWidth
member.summary: The columns has fixed, unchangeable width.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ColumnStyle.AutoWidth
member.summary: The columns' width changes when the table is resized.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DelKeyAction
member.summary: Specifies the type of action performed when the user presses the DEL key.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DelKeyAction.None
member.summary: Indicates that nothing happens.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DelKeyAction.DeleteActiveItem
member.summary: Indicates that only the ActiveItem is deleted.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DelKeyAction.DeleteSelectedItems
member.summary: Indicates that all selected items are deleted.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CursorHint
member.summary: Specifies what mouse cursor to display while a user interacts with the diagram.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CursorHint.Move
member.summary: Indicates the cursor specified by the MoveCursor property.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CursorHint.Rotate
member.summary: Indicates the cursor specified by the RotateCursor property.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CursorHint.HorizontalResize
member.summary: Indicates the cursor specified by the HorizontalResizeCursor property.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CursorHint.VerticalResize
member.summary: Indicates the cursor specified by the VerticalResizeCursor property.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CursorHint.DiagonalResize
member.summary: Indicates the cursor specified by the DiagonalResizeCursor property.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CursorHint.CounterDiagonalResize
member.summary: Indicates the cursor specified by the CounterDiagonalResizeCursor property.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CursorHint.DrawLink
member.summary: Indicates the cursor specified by the DrawLinkCursor property.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CursorHint.Pointer
member.summary: Indicates the cursor specified by the PointerCursor property.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CursorHint.AllowLink
member.summary: Indicates the cursor specified by the AllowLinkCursor property.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CursorHint.DisallowLink
member.summary: Indicates the cursor specified by the DisallowLinkCursor property.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CursorHint.Disallow
member.summary: Indicates the cursor specified by the DisallowCursor property.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CursorHint.DontChange
member.summary: Indicates the cursor specified by the Cursor property.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CustomDraw
member.summary: Specifies what kind of custom painting to perform on diagram elements.
member.remarks: These values can be assigned to the CustomDraw property of shapes, tables and links.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CustomDraw.None
member.summary: Do not perform custom drawing, let all painting be done by WpfDiagram.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CustomDraw.Additional
member.summary: The custom painting code executes after item's interior and frame are painted by WpfDiagram, but before text is rendered. In this mode, the DrawingContext instance passed to the custom drawing event handler has a clipping region applied to it.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CustomDraw.Full
member.summary: The component does not do any standard drawing, the entire painting of an item is done by the application.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.CustomDraw.Additional2
member.summary: The custom painting code executes after all parts of an item are painted by WpfDiagram. In this mode, the DrawingContext instance passed to the custom drawing event handler doesn't have a clipping region applied to it.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.SaveToStringFormat
member.summary: Specifies in what format to save the diagram when generating a string using the SaveToString method.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.SaveToStringFormat.Xml
member.summary: Indicates a non-compressed XML output.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.SaveToStringFormat.CompressedXml
member.summary: Indicates a compressed XML output.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DirectionConstraint
member.summary: Defines values that specify in what direction to constrain node movement.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DirectionConstraint.None
member.summary: No restrictions.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DirectionConstraint.Horizontal
member.summary: Users are allowed to move the node horizontally.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DirectionConstraint.Vertical
member.summary: Users are allowed to move the node vertically.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ExpandButtonAction
member.summary: Specifies what action is triggered by the +/- buttons that are displayed near expandable nodes.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ExpandButtonAction.ExpandTreeBranch
member.summary: Expands or collapses the children of a node in a tree-like diagram and raises the TreeExpanded or TreeCollapsed event.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ExpandButtonAction.RaiseEvents
member.summary: Raises the ExpandButtonClicked event.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ExpandButtonPosition
member.summary: Defines values that specify possible locations for expand/collapse buttons.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ExpandButtonPosition.OuterRight
member.summary: Place expand/collapse buttons at the right-hand side of their nodes.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ExpandButtonPosition.OuterLowerRight
member.summary: Place expand/collapse buttons at the lower-right corner of their nodes.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ExpandButtonPosition.OuterUpperRight
member.summary: Place expand/collapse buttons at the upper-right corner of their nodes.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ExpandButtonPosition.OuterBottom
member.summary: Place expand/collapse buttons at the bottom side of their nodes.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ExpandButtonPosition.OuterLeft
member.summary: Place expand/collapse buttons at the left-hand side of their nodes.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ExpandButtonPosition.OuterLowerLeft
member.summary: Place expand/collapse buttons at the lower-left corner of their nodes.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ExpandButtonPosition.OuterUpperLeft
member.summary: Place expand/collapse buttons at the upper-left corner of their nodes.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ExpandButtonPosition.OuterTop
member.summary: Place expand/collapse buttons at the top side of their nodes.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ExpandButtonPosition.Custom
member.summary: Place the expand/collapse button at a position returned by the CustomExpandButtonPosition delegate.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.FitSize
member.summary: Specifies how the ResizeToFitText method should resize a node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.FitSize.KeepWidth
member.summary: Specifies that the original node width should remain intact.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.FitSize.KeepHeight
member.summary: Specifies that the original node height should remain intact.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.FitSize.KeepRatio
member.summary: Allows changing both the width and height of a node, but keep the original width/height ratio if possible.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.GridStyle
member.summary: Defines values that specify the visual style of the alignment grid.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.GridStyle.Points
member.summary: The grid is painted as a matrix of points.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.GridStyle.Lines
member.summary: The grid is represented as a series of crossing horizontal and vertical lines.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.GroupAnchorStyles
member.summary: Specifies the master node edges to which a subordinate node can be anchored.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.GroupAnchorStyles.Left
member.summary: Specifies the left edge.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.GroupAnchorStyles.Top
member.summary: Specifies the top edge.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.GroupAnchorStyles.Right
member.summary: Specifies the right edge.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.GroupAnchorStyles.Bottom
member.summary: Specifies the bottom edge.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles
member.summary: Identifies the distinct selection handles of a node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.None
member.summary: Specifies that none of the selection handles can be used to modify the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeTopLeft
member.summary: The top-left handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeTopRight
member.summary: The top-right handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeBottomRight
member.summary: The bottom-right handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeBottomLeft
member.summary: The bottom-left handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeTopCenter
member.summary: The top-center handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node vertically.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeMiddleRight
member.summary: The middle-right handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node horizontally.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeBottomCenter
member.summary: The bottom-center handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node vertically.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeMiddleLeft
member.summary: The middle-left handle is enabled and can be used to resize the node horizontally.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.Move
member.summary: The center selection handle is enabled and can be used to move the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.Rotate
member.summary: The rotation handle is enabled and can be used to rotate the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.All
member.summary: All selection handles areenabled and canbe used to modify the node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.LeftHandles
member.summary: The top-left, middle-left and bottom-left handles are enabled.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.RightHandles
member.summary: The top-right, bottom-right and middle-right handles are enabled.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.TopHandles
member.summary: The top-left, top-center and top-right handles are enabled.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.BottomHandles
member.summary: The bottom-left, bottom-center and bottom-right handles are enabled.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.CornerHandles
member.summary: The four corner handles are enabled.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.MiddleHandles
member.summary: The four middle handles are enabled.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.ResizeHandles
member.summary: The eight resize handles are enabled.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.WidthHandles
member.summary: All left and right handles are enabled.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AdjustmentHandles.HeightHandles
member.summary: All top and bottom handles are enabled.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HandlesStyle
member.summary: Enumerates possible visual styles for frames that are drawn around selected nodes.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HandlesStyle.Invisible
member.summary: There is no visible difference between selected and unselected node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HandlesStyle.SquareHandles
member.summary: If selected, the node is drawn with square modification handles.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HandlesStyle.DashFrame
member.summary: If selected, a node is drawn with a dashed frame. The frame enables resizing the node. The center of the node allows moving it and the edge area enables creating links.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HandlesStyle.HatchFrame
member.summary: If selected, the object is drawn with hatched frame. Modifications can be done as with DashFrame.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HandlesStyle.HatchHandles
member.summary: If selected, a node is drawn with both hatched frame and modification handles. The frame enable moving the node, and the handles enable resizing. Links are created from any point of the interior.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HandlesStyle.HatchHandles2
member.summary: Looks like HatchHandles, but allows moving the node from the interior area. Links are created from the points near the edge.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HandlesStyle.HatchHandles3
member.summary: Behaves like HatchHandles2, but paints the selection frame using a denser brush pattern.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HandlesStyle.MoveOnly
member.summary: If a node is selected, it can be only moved. Best used with ModificationStart set to AutoHandles.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HandlesStyle.EasyMove
member.summary: Any point of the interior of a node enables moving the node, except a small area in the center that allows creating links. Best used with ModificationStart set to AutoHandles.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HandlesStyle.SquareHandles2
member.summary: Square resize handles are drawn around a selected node. There isn't a move-handle in the center as with the SquareHandles style, but nodes can be moved by dragging their interior or caption areas. Links can be created by drawing from near the edges of a node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HandlesStyle.Custom
member.summary: WpfDiagram raises the DrawHandles and HitTestAdjustmentHandles events to let your application perform custom drawing and hit testing of selection handles.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HandlesStyle.InvisibleMove
member.summary: There aren't any selection handles displayed. The selected node can be only moved, but not resized.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HitTestPriority
member.summary: Defines values that specify the order of item hit-testing.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HitTestPriority.ZOrder
member.summary: Test items in decreasing z-order, independently of their types.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HitTestPriority.NodesBeforeLinks
member.summary: Test nodes first, then links.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ControlMouseAction
member.summary: Specifies available ways to handle mouse clicks on .NET controls hosted in a ControlNode.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ControlMouseAction.PassToControl
member.summary: Let the control handle the mouse click. Do not select the host node.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ControlMouseAction.SelectNode
member.summary: The host node gets selected when the control is clicked. The control is left to handle the mouse click too.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ControlMouseAction.IgnoreControl
member.summary: WpfDiagram tries to intercept the mouse message and not pass it to the control. That allows drawing links from anywhere within the control.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MarkStyle
member.summary: Specifies the visual style of anchor point marks.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MarkStyle.None
member.summary: No visual indication for the anchor point.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MarkStyle.Cross
member.summary: No visual indication for the anchor point.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MarkStyle.X
member.summary: Anchor point marked with an 'X'.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MarkStyle.Circle
member.summary: Anchor point marked with a circle.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MarkStyle.Rectangle
member.summary: Anchor point marked with a rectangle.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MarkStyle.Custom
member.summary: A DrawAnchorPoint event is fired, allowing custom painting of anchor points.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ModificationStart
member.summary: Specifies how the user can start modifying an item.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ModificationStart.SelectedOnly
member.summary: Only selected objects can be modified.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ModificationStart.AutoHandles

member.summary: While the modifier key is pressed down, dragging the mouse starts creating a new item or drawing a selection rectangle instead of modifying a selected item. Otherwise, dragging the mouse could start modification of the selected item.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringFormatFlags
member.summary: Replaces System.Drawing.StringFormatFlags

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringFormatFlags.DirectionRightToLeft
member.summary: Text is displayed from right to left.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringFormatFlags.DirectionVertical
member.summary: Text is vertically aligned.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringFormatFlags.FitBlackBox
member.summary: Parts of characters are allowed to overhang the string's layout rectangle. By default, characters are repositioned to avoid any overhang.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringFormatFlags.DisplayFormatControl
member.summary: Control characters such as the left-to-right mark are shown in the output with a representative glyph.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringFormatFlags.NoFontFallback
member.summary: Fallback to alternate fonts for characters not supported in the requested font is disabled. Any missing characters are displayed with the fonts missing glyph, usually an open square.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringFormatFlags.MeasureTrailingSpaces
member.summary: Includes the trailing space at the end of each line. By default the boundary rectangle returned by the MeasureString method excludes the space at the end of each line. Set this flag to include that space in measurement.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringFormatFlags.NoWrap
member.summary: Text wrapping between lines when formatting within a rectangle is disabled. This flag is implied when a point is passed instead of a rectangle, or when the specified rectangle has a zero line length.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringFormatFlags.LineLimit
member.summary: Only entire lines are laid out in the formatting rectangle. By default layout continues until the end of the text, or until no more lines are visible as a result of clipping, whichever comes first. Note that the default settings allow the last line to be partially obscured by a formatting rectangle that is not a whole multiple of the line height. To ensure that only whole lines are seen, specify this value and be careful to provide a formatting rectangle at least as tall as the height of one line.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringFormatFlags.NoClip
member.summary: Overhanging parts of glyphs, and unwrapped text reaching outside the formatting rectangle are allowed to show. By default all text and glyph parts reaching outside the formatting rectangle are clipped.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HotkeyPrefix
member.summary: Replaces System.Drawing.Text.HotkeyPrefix

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HotkeyPrefix.None
member.summary: No hot-key prefix.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HotkeyPrefix.Show
member.summary: Display the hot-key prefix.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.HotkeyPrefix.Hide
member.summary: Do not display the hot-key prefix.

member.summary: Specifies no trimming.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringTrimming.Character
member.summary: Specifies that the text is trimmed to the nearest character.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringTrimming.Word
member.summary: Specifies that text is trimmed to the nearest word.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringTrimming.EllipsisCharacter
member.summary: Specifies that the text is trimmed to the nearest character, and an ellipsis is inserted at the end of a trimmed line.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringTrimming.EllipsisWord
member.summary: Specifies that text is trimmed to the nearest word, and an ellipsis is inserted at the end of a trimmed line.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringTrimming.EllipsisPath
member.summary: The center is removed from trimmed lines and replaced by an ellipsis. The algorithm keeps as much of the last slash-delimited segment of the line as possible.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringAlignment
member.summary: Replaces System.Drawing.StringAlignment

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringAlignment.Near
member.summary: Specifies the text be aligned near the layout. In a left-to-right layout, the near position is left. In a right-to-left layout, the near position is right.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned in the center of the layout rectangle.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.StringAlignment.Far
member.summary: Specifies that text is aligned far from the origin position of the layout rectangle. In a left-to-right layout, the far position is right. In a right-to-left layout, the far position is left.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.Layout.MultipleGraphsPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how multiple independent graphs in the diagram should be positioned relatively to each other.
member.value: A member of the MultipleGraphsPlacement enumeration. The default value is Horizontal.
member.remarks: If the diagram contains several unconnected subgraphs, each of them is processed by the algorithm independently from the others. This property specifies how such subgraphs should be placed one relatively to another. The possible options are to arrange them in a row, in a column, or in such a way that the diagram covers a minimal area.

member.remarks: When applying a radial layout, node layers are laid out in concentric circles around the Root node. Stretching them by changing this property makes layers laid out in elliptic outlines.

member.value: true to ignore link direction; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.remarks: Parent-child direction is considered the one in which nodes go further from the root, instead that of the links. If IgnoreLinkDirection is set to true, you must explicitly specify the tree Root.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.TreeLayout.CompactAssistants
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the "assistant" nodes on the same side of a single parent are arranged as close enough to each other as possible. Turning this off will force the nodes on one side to be aligned with their counterparts in the other and occasionally leaving space between adjacent branches.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout
member.summary: Implements a simulated annealing graph layout algorithm.
member.remarks: Simulated Annealing is a general-purpose optimization method used to solve large-scale combinatorial problems by simulating the process of heating and cooling of metal to achieve freedom from defects. Finding a nice arrangement of a graph is a combinatorial problem that can be reduced to assigning costs to graph configurations and finding the minimum cost configuration. In that case, a cost is assigned to a graph configuration by evaluating different aesthetic criteria such as distance between nodes, length of links and the number of link crossings.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the AnnealLayout class.

member.summary: Initializes the layout object for a step-by-step execution.
member.param: The Diagram that will be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: true if the layout object has been initialized successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.Iterate(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Runs one or more layout iterations.
member.param: Specifies from which iteration to start.
Specifies at which iteration to stop.
member.remarks: Use this method to create an animation of the layout process, for example, by calling it from a timer. Call BeginArrange to prepare the layout object for use of Iterate, and call EndArrange when done. Each call to Iterate starts from the iteration next to the one where the previous call has stopped.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.Name
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.Root
member.summary: Gets or sets a node indicating which subgraph of the diagram should be laid out.
member.value: A DiagramNode whose containing graph should be arranged. The default is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: If a root nodes is specified and SplitGraph is enabled, only the graph that contains the root node is laid out by Arrange.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.DistributionFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the importance of the node distribution, relative to the other criteria considered by the algorithm.
member.value: A double multiplier applied to the node distribution cost when evaluating the total cost of a graph configuration. The default is 560000.
member.remarks: Assigning a larger value to this property will make the algorithm choose graph configurations in which the nodes are placed farther one from another.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.BoundaryFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the importance of the distance between nodes and the layout area boundaries, relative to the other criteria considered by the algorithm.
member.value: A double multiplier applied to the node-to-boundary distance cost when evaluating the total cost of a graph configuration. The default is 42000.
member.remarks: Assigning a larger value to this property will make the algorithm choose graph configurations in which nodes are placed farther from the layout area bounds, that is, nodes will tend to gather in the center of the layout area.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.LinkLengthFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the importance of the short length of links, relative to the other criteria considered by the algorithm.
member.value: A double multiplier applied to the link length cost when evaluating the total cost of a graph configuration. The default is 0.02.
member.remarks: Assigning a larger value to this property will make the algorithm choose graph configurations in which links are shorter.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.CrossingLinksCost
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the importance of the low number of link crossings, relative to the other criteria considered by the algorithm.
member.value: A double value added to the total cost of a graph configuration for each pair of crossing links. The default is 1200000.
member.remarks: Assigning a larger value to this property will make the algorithm choose graph configurations with fewer link crossings.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.NodeLinkCrossingCost
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the importance of low number of overlaps between links and nodes relative to the other criteria considered by the algorithm.
member.value: A double value added to the total cost of a graph configuration when a link crosses a node. The default is 150000.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.NodeLinkDistFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the importance of the distance between nodes and links, relative to the other criteria considered by the algorithm.
member.value: A double value specifying the distance factor. The default value is 320000.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.InitialTemperature
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial temperature of the simulated annealing process.
member.value: A double value specifying the initial temperature of the simulation. The default is 40.
member.remarks: A low initial temperature prevents nodes from moving far from their initial position.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.TemperatureScale
member.summary: Gets or sets how much the simulated temperature is decreased at each stage of the algorithm.
member.value: A double multiplier applied to the simulated temperature at each stage of the algorithm. The default is 0.75.
member.remarks: This value should be in the interval (0, 1). The algorithm produces better results when running for many Stages with a gradual temperature decrease, that is, a TemperatureScale closer to 1.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.IterationsPerStage
member.summary: Gets or sets how many node shift iterations to perform at each stage of the algorithm.
member.value: An integer value specifying the number of node shift iterations. The default is 50.
member.remarks: IterationsPerStage specifies how many node configurations to evaluate at each stage of the temperature cool-down simulation.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.Stages
member.summary: Gets or sets how many cool-down stages the algorithm should simulate.
member.value: An integer value specifying the number of temperature decreases the simulation should run. The default is 15.
member.remarks: At each stage the algorithm evaluates different graph arrangements produced by modifying the best configuration from the previous stage.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.LayoutArea
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the layout area.
member.value: A System.Windows.Rect structure representing the boundaries of the layout area. The default is Rect.Empty.
member.remarks: If the layout area is not explicitly set, the algorithm will choose one suitable for the graph size.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.WidthHeightRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets what width/height ratio the layout area should have.
member.value: A real number specifying the layout area width to height ratio. The default is 1.
member.remarks: If the LayoutArea is not explicitly set, the algorithm will choose one suitable for the graph size. In that case the WidthHeightRatio property specifies how much larger the layout area width should be than its height.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.Randomize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the nodes should be placed at random positions when the layout routine starts.
member.value: true to start the simulation with random node positions; false to start it with the original node positions. The default is true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.SplitGraph
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether unconnected subgraphs should be laid out independently from each other.
member.value: true if unconnected graphs in the diagram should be laid out independently; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true, each independent graph in the diagram is laid out in its own layout area. Otherwise all subgraphs are arranged in the same layout area.

member.summary: Returns statistics about the layout execution and end results.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.AnnealLayout.GatherStatistics
member.summary: Specifies whether the layout should gather statistics while running.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.SpringLayout
member.summary: Implements the Spring-Embedder graph layout algorithm.
member.remarks: Spring-Embedder produces layouts having uniform distribution of nodes by simulating a physical system in which nodes repulse each other and the links between them act as confining springs. Nodes are moved around in an iterative process. The forces that act on a node are calculated, taking in account the positions of surrounding nodes and links from the previous iteration.

member.summary: Gets or sets for how many iterations to run the layout routine.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.SpringLayout.NodeDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between nodes.
member.value: A real number specifying the distance between nodes. The default is 96.
member.remarks: The final distance between connected nodes is determined by multiplying the Weight of the link that connects them by the value of NodeDistance.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.SpringLayout.MinimizeCrossings
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether crossing minimization mode is enabled.
member.value: true to attempt crossing minimization; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.remarks: If enabled, the algorithm tries to decrease number of crossing links. For better results, use greater IterationCount.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.SpringLayout.EnableClusters
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to enable allocation of nodes to distinct clusters.
member.value: true to detect and process node clusters; otherwise, false. The default is false.
member.remarks: If enabled, the SpringLayout algorithm detects node clusters and places them at distinct positions. Each cluster consists of a center node surrounded by several local nodes. Clusters might be connected with other clusters via their center nodes. Best-looking results are achieved when there aren't links between the local nodes in a cluster.

member.value: true to start the simulation with random node positions; false to start it with the original node positions. The default is true.

member.summary: Implements a layered graph layout algorithm.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LayeredLayout class with the default settings.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the LayeredLayout class with the specified settings.
member.param: The orientation of the layout.
The distance between adjacent layers.
The distance between adjacent nodes within the same layer.
The margin between the produced graph and the left side of the diagram bounding rectangle.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.Arrange(MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram,MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramItemCollection)
member.summary: Applies the layout to the specified subset of items from the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: This method always returns true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.Name
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the overall orientation of the arranged diagram.
member.value: A member of the Orientation enumeration. The default is Vertical.
member.remarks: Specify Orientation.Vertical to have links flow in vertical direction and Orientation.Horizontal to have links flow in horizontal direction. The orientation of the resulting layers is opposite to that of the links. Thus, if the link tends to go in a vertical direction, the nodes are distributed in horizontal layers.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.Direction
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the arranged diagram.
member.value: A member of the Direction enumeration. The default is Straight.
member.remarks: If Orientation is set to Horizontal, Direction.Straight stands for "left to right" and Direction.Reversed for "right to left". If Orientation is set to Vertical, Direction.Straight stands for "top to bottom" and Direction.Reversed for "bottom to top".

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.LayerDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between layer axis lines.
member.value: A real number specifying the distance between layers.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.NodeDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between adjacent nodes in a layer.
member.value: A real number specifying the distance between adjacent nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.SplitLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to split layers that are much wider than the other layers.
member.value: true to split wide layers; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.LinksCompactFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how much to compact the outermost arrows.
member.value: A real number in the interval [0, 1]. The default is 1.
member.remarks: Links and nodes on the same graph layer are distributed uniformly as specified by the NodeDistance value. However, if there are more than 2-3 outermost links on a layer, they usually take up too much space without improving the visual quality of the diagram layout. This property allows compacting such links to save space. The factor specifies roughly a fraction of NodeDistance to leave between outer links.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.TimeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a time-out value for the path-finding part of the layered layout algorithm.
member.value: An integer value specifying time-out in milliseconds. The default is 10000 (10 seconds).
member.remarks: The layered layout algorithm arranges graph nodes and links along the longest path in the graph. Large graphs with many links could contain hundreds of thousands of possible paths, so finding the longest one would be very time-consuming. When the time-out set with this property occurs, the path-finding routine stops and the layout algorithm uses the longest path known at that moment. Usually, for graphs containing several hundreds of nodes, 1-2 seconds are enough to find a long-enough path to produce nice layered layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.SwapPairsIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets how many times to perform pair-swapping iterations on each layer.
member.value: An integer value specifying how many pair-swapping iterations to perform. The default is 5.
member.remarks: The algorithm swaps node pairs on each layer aiming to decrease the number of crossing links. Setting a higher value to this property helps to decrease the number of crossings.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.Root
member.summary: Gets or sets a node indicating which subgraph of the diagram must be laid out.
member.value: An instance of the DiagramNode class. The default is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: All links and nodes that can be reached from the root by following recursively its links form a graph. If the root is specified, only the graph containing it is laid out by Arrange.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.IgnoreNodeSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the distance between adjacent nodes in the final layout should be independent of the nodes' size.
member.value: true to ignore the node size; otherwise, false. The default is true.
member.remarks: At this time, considering the size of nodes deteriorates the performance of the algorithm, so that's disabled by default.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.EnableCustomLayers
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to indicating whether the layered layout will honor the LayeredLayoutTraits.Layer flags.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.LinkType
member.summary: Gets or sets the appearance of the links in the final layout.
member.value: A member of the LayeredLayoutLinkType enumeration. The default is Straight.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.Statistics
member.summary: Gets layout-specific information about the nodes and links participating in the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.KeepRootPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to preserve the position of the root node.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.EnforceLinkFlow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to attempt to force all links to go in the same direction. If the graph being arrange has cycles, some of the links will still go backward.
member.remarks: EnableCustomLayers and SplitLayers are ignored if this property is set to true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.StraightenLongLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the layout algorithm should strive to straighten links that cross more than one layer of the graph.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.StableSort
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to apply stable sorting during the layout algorithm. Stable sorting sometimes produces more readable results.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.StartNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the node that should be placed in the first layer of the arranged graph.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.LayeredLayout.EndNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the node that should be placed in the last layer of the arranged graph.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.OrthogonalLayout
member.summary: Implements an orthogonal graph layout algorithm. Each link is drawn as a chain of alternating horizontal and vertical segments. Nodes are placed in a way that facilitates few links bends and crossings.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the OrthogonalLayout class with the default settings.

member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: This method always returns true.

member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.OrthogonalLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.OrthogonalLayout.MinimizeLinkBends
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the layout should attempt to minimize link bending.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.TriangularLayout
member.summary: Performs triangular layout on simple, connected graphs.
member.remarks: The triangular layout places vertices on a virtual grid, such that if the source graph is planar is guaranteed that all links will have a single segment and will not intersect. If the graph is not planar, the intersecting links are optionally segmented and bended in order to improve readability.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.TriangularLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the TriangularLayout class.

member.summary: Layout.BuildGraph override.

member.summary: Applies the layout to the specified subset of items from the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: This method always returns true.

member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.TriangularLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.TriangularLayout.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets a the orientation of the arranged graph.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.TriangularLayout.BendNonplanarLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the intersecting links in a non-planar graphs will be segmented and bended to improve presentation.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.TriangularLayout.GridSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the virtual grid the layout will place vertices on.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.CascadeLayout
member.summary: Performs cascading layout on simple, connected graphs.
member.remarks: The cascade layout places vertices on a virtual grid and arranges edges orthogonally, such that if the source graph is planar it is guaranteed that all edges will have no more than two bends and will not intersect.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.CascadeLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CascadeLayout class.

member.summary: Layout.BuildGraph override.

member.summary: Applies the layout to the specified subset of items from the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: This method always returns true.

member.summary: Checks whether the specified link intersects a node in the specified graph.

member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.
