member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.CascadeLayout.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets a the orientation of the arranged graph.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.CascadeLayout.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets the spacing between nodes in adjacent layers.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.HierarchicalLayout
member.summary: Performs hierarchical layout on simple, connected, level-planar graphs.
member.remarks: The hierarchical layout places vertices on predefined levels, such that if the source graph is level-planar it is guaranteed that all edges will have a single segment and will not intersect. A planar graph is considered level-planar if it is still possible to draw it without edge intersections when its vertices are positioned on predefined levels.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.HierarchicalLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the HierarchicalLayout class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.HierarchicalLayout.BuildGraph(MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram,MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramItemCollection)
member.summary: Layout.BuildGraph override.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.HierarchicalLayout.Arrange(MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram,MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramItemCollection)
member.summary: Applies the layout to the specified subset of items from the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: false, if there is a node in the graph without assigned level; otherwise, true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.HierarchicalLayout.Name
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.HierarchicalLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.HierarchicalLayout.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets a the orientation of the arranged graph.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.HierarchicalLayout.LevelDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between adjacent levels in the hierarchical layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.HierarchicalLayout.LinkBendFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the bending factor of links.
member.remarks: A value of 1 indicates that the links should not bend. A value less than 1 indicates that the links should bend towards the geometric center of the graph. A value greater than 1 indicates that the links should bend outwards.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.CircularLayout
member.summary: Implements a circular graph layout algorithm. Nodes are distributed evenly on the circumference of a circle at positions that result in as few link crossing as possible.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.CircularLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the CircularLayout class with the default settings.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.CircularLayout.BuildGraph(MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram,MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramItemCollection)
member.summary: Layout.BuildGraph override.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.CircularLayout.Arrange(MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram,MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramItemCollection)
member.summary: Applies the layout to the specified subset of items from the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: This method always returns true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.CircularLayout.Name
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.CircularLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.CircularLayout.Radius
member.summary: Gets or sets the radius of the layout circle.
member.remarks: If this property is set to 0, the layout will try to find an appropriate radius depending on the number and size of the participating nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.CircularLayout.SiftingRounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of sifts to perform during the layout.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.GridLayout
member.summary: Implements a grid graph layout algorithm.
member.remarks: GridLayout arranges diagram nodes in a grid, keeping connected nodes close together. The algorithm strives to achieve a small number of link crossings. It is based on an iterative process whose initial steps shuffle the grid nodes randomly. That can lead to very different results each time the algorithm is run.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.GridLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the GridLayout class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.GridLayout.Arrange(MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram,MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramItemCollection)
member.summary: Applies the layout to a subgraph of the specified Diagram instance.
member.param: The Diagram that should be arranged.
A collection of nodes and links from diagram that define the subgraph to arrange.
member.returns: true if the layout is successfully applied; false if StartNode and EndNode are specified and there is no path between them.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.GridLayout.Name
member.summary: Gets a user-friendly name of the layout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.GridLayout.DefaultMarginValue
member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.GridLayout.StartNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the node that is placed at the upper left corner of the grid.
member.value: An instance of the DiagramNode class. The default is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: If you assign a node to that property, then EndNode cannot be null and must be set too. GridLayout usually produces better layouts if both StartNode and EndNode are null references; in such a case the algorithm automatically selects suitable nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.GridLayout.EndNode
member.summary: Gets or sets the node that is placed at the lower right corner of the grid.
member.value: An instance of the DiagramNode class. Default value is null (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: If you assign a node to that property, then StartNode cannot be null and must be set too. GridLayout usually produces better layouts if both StartNode and EndNode are null references; in such a case the algorithm automatically selects suitable nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.GridLayout.Iterations
member.summary: Gets or sets for how many iterations to run the grid layout algorithm.
member.value: An integer number specifying the number of iterations. The default is 3000.
member.remarks: More iterations would yield better layouts but require more time to complete.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.GridLayout.GridSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between adjacent grid points.
member.value: A real number specifying the grid size. The default is 96.
member.remarks: When placing a node at a grid position, the node center point is aligned to the grid point at that position.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.GridLayout.RandomSeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the randomization seed to use for generating random node positions.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.GridLayout.SplitGraph
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to split the graph to its interconnected subgraphs and arrange the subgraphs independently or arrange the graph as a whole.
member.value: true to split the graph; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.GridLayout.Root
member.summary: Gets or sets a node indicating which subgraph of the diagram should be laid out.
member.value: An instance of the DiagramNode class. The default is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.remarks: All links and nodes that can be reached from the root by following recursively its links form a graph. If the root is specified, only the graph which it defines is laid out by Arrange.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.GridLayout.UseLongestPath
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the algorithm should arrange nodes around the longest path in the graph.
member.value: true to look for the longest path in the graph and arrange nodes around it; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Initially, the algorithm places nodes and links from the longest path in the graph at the grid diagonal, and arranges the rest of the nodes around the diagonal. Large graphs with many links could contain hundreds of thousands of possible paths, so finding the longest one would be very time-consuming. Disabling this property will let you skip the path-finding part of the algorithm, which will make it work much faster.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.GridLayout.TimeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a time-out value for the path-finding part of the grid layout algorithm.
member.value: An integer value specifying time-out in milliseconds. The default is 10000 (10 seconds).
member.remarks: The grid layout algorithm arranges graph nodes and links along the longest path in the graph. Large graphs with many links could contain hundreds of thousands of possible paths, so finding the longest one would be very time-consuming. When the time-out set with this property occurs, the path-finding routine stops and the layout algorithm uses the longest path known at that moment. Usually, for graphs containing several hundreds of nodes, 1-2 seconds are enough to find a path long enough to produce a nice layout.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.OrthogonalRouter
member.summary: Implements an orthogonal link routing algorithm.

member.summary: Gets the default value of the Margins property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.BendDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets how far from its adjacent node a link should bend.
member.value: A real number specifying the distance from a link's first bend to its adjacent node. The default is 0, specifying that the algorithm should automatically choose a value for this parameter.
member.remarks: This should be a value between 0 and 1, specifying a distance proportional to the node size.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.GridSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between adjacent grid points when BaseLayout is set to Grid.
member.value: A real number specifying the grid size. The default is 96.
member.remarks: This value is assigned to the GridSize property of the base GridLayout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.RandomSeed
member.summary: Gets or sets the randomization seed to use for generating random node positions.

member.summary: Gets or sets the overall orientation of the arranged diagram when BaseLayout is set to Layered.
member.value: An instance of the Orientation enumeration. The default is Vertical.
member.remarks: This value is assigned to the Orientation property of the base LayeredLayout.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.Direction
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the arranged diagram when BaseLayout is set to Layered.
member.value: A member of the Direction enumeration. The default is Straight.
member.remarks: This value is assigned to the Direction property of the base LayeredLayout.

member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between layer axis lines.
member.value: A real number specifying the distance between layers. The default is 96.
member.remarks: Gets or sets the distance between layers when BaseLayout is set to Layered or Cascading.

member.summary: Gets or sets the desired distance between adjacent nodes in a layer.
member.value: A real number specifying the distance between adjacent nodes. The default is 96.
member.remarks: Gets or sets the distance between nodes in the same layer when BaseLayout is set to Layered or Cascading.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the end points of a link should be placed at the outlines of the nodes connected by that link.

member.summary: Gets or sets the desired orientation of the first segments of routed links.
member.value: A member of the Orientation enumeration. The default value is Auto.
member.remarks: If this property is set to Horizontal, links will end at the left or right sides of nodes. If set to Vertical, links will end at the top or bottom sides.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.OrthogonalRouter.EndOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired orientation of the last segments of routed links.
member.value: A member of the Orientation enumeration. The default value is Auto.
member.remarks: If this property is set to Horizontal, links will end at the left or right sides of nodes. If set to Vertical, links will end at the top or bottom sides.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Layout.FractalLayout
member.summary: A tree layout algorithm that places child nodes symmetrically around their parent node.
member.remarks: Nodes at the lowest level are arranged directly in a circle around their parent. At the upper level, the already arranged nodes form branches that are arranged in a circle around the new parent node. The algorithm is recursively repeated till the highest level is reached.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MathUtils.GetProjectionMatrix(System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Camera,System.Double)
member.summary: Computes the effective projection matrix for the given camera.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MathUtils.TryWorldToViewportTransform(System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual,System.Boolean@)
member.summary:
Computes the transform from world space to the Viewport3DVisual's inner 2D space.
This method can fail if Camera.Transform is non-invertable in which case the camera clip planes will be coincident and nothing will render. In this case success will be false.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MathUtils.TryWorldToCameraTransform(System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual,System.Boolean@)
member.summary:
Computes the transform from world space to camera space
This method can fail if Camera.Transform is non-invertable in which case the camera clip planes will be coincident and nothing will render. In this case success will be false.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MathUtils.GetWorldTransformationMatrix(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual@)
member.summary: Gets the object space to world space transformation for the given DependencyObject
member.param: The visual whose world space transform should be found
The Viewport3DVisual the Visual is contained within
member.returns: The world space transformation

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MathUtils.TryTransformTo2DAncestor(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary:
Computes the transform from the inner space of the given Visual3D to the 2D space of the Viewport3DVisual which contains it.
The result will contain the transform of the given visual.
This method can fail if Camera.Transform is non-invertable in which case the camera clip planes will be coincident and nothing will render. In this case success will be false.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MathUtils.TryTransformToCameraSpace(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Viewport3DVisual@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary:
Computes the transform from the inner space of the given Visual3D to the camera coordinate space
The result will contain the transform of the given visual.
This method can fail if Camera.Transform is non-invertable in which case the camera clip planes will be coincident and nothing will render. In this case success will be false.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MathUtils.TransformBounds(System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Rect3D,System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Matrix3D)
member.summary: Transforms the axis-aligned bounding box 'bounds' by 'transform'
member.param: The AABB to transform
member.returns: Transformed AABB

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.MathUtils.TryNormalize(System.Windows.Media.Media3D.Vector3D@)
member.summary:
Normalizes v if |v| > 0.
This normalization is slightly different from Vector3D.Normalize. Here we just divide by the length but Vector3D.Normalize tries to avoid overflow when finding the length.
member.param: The vector to normalize
member.returns: 'true' if v was normalized

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.ScreenSpaceLines3D
member.summary:
ScreenSpaceLines3D are a 3D line primitive whose thickness is constant in 2D space post projection.
This means that the lines do not become foreshortened as they receed from the camera as other 3D primitives do under a typical perspective projection.
Example Usage:
<tools:ScreenSpaceLines3D Points="0,0,0 0,1,0 0,1,0 1,1,0 1,1,0 0,0,1" Thickness="5" Color="Red">
"Screen space" is a bit of a misnomer as the line thickness is specified in the 2D coordinate system of the container Viewport3D, not the screen.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.XmlPersistContext.brushes
member.summary: A map of all diagram brushes.
member.remarks: During serialization, this map will contain all serialized brushes, mapped to their indices. During deserialization, the brushes are loaded from the appropriate section in the Xml file, the first time they are accessed. This list is of type (Brush, int) when serializing and of type (int, Brush) when deserializing.

member.name: F:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.XmlPersistContext.images
member.summary: A map of all diagram images.
member.remarks: During serialization, this map will contain all serialized images, mapped to their indices. During deserialization, the images are loaded from the appropriate section in the Xml file, the first time they are accessed. This list is of type (Image, int) when serializing and of type (int, Image) when deserializing.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DeserializationHack
member.summary: .NET 1.1 framework cannot load .NET 1.0 serialized classes, and vice versa; which is kind of stupid for classes such as Size and Rectangle; so we just try to find any needed type in loaded assemblies here.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.Shape
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of link segments and how they are positioned relatively to each other.
member.remarks: This property specifies whether the segments of a link are straight lines or curves.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.HeadPen
member.summary: Gets or sets the pen to use when painting arrowheads lines.
member.remarks: This property refers to a pen used to paint arrowhead lines.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.TextStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the link's text placement and orientation.

member.summary: Gets or sets the shape of this link's arrowhead.
member.remarks: The property specifies what shape is displayed as an arrowhead.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.BaseShape
member.summary: Gets or sets what shape to display at the beginning of a link.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.IntermediateShape
member.summary: Gets or sets the shape displayed at the middle of each segment of the link.
member.remarks: The property specifies what shape to display at the middle of each segment of a link.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.HeadShapeSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the arrowhead shape.
member.remarks: The property specifies how big the shape of the arrowhead is.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.BaseShapeSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the BaseShape shape.
member.remarks: The property specifies how big is the shape that is displayed at the origin of a link.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.IntermediateShapeSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the IntermediateShape shape.
member.remarks: The property specifies how big are the shapes that are displayed in the middle of link segments.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.OriginAnchor
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the origin anchor point within the AnchorPattern that contains it.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.DestinationAnchor
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of the destination anchor point within the AnchorPattern that contains it.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.SegmentCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of segments of this link.
member.remarks: Use this property to make a link more indented, when necessary.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.InternalSegmentCount
member.summary: Invoked internally to set the segment count unconditionally (i.e. when loading from XML).

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.DirectSegmentCount
member.summary: Sets the number of segments of this link without reordering or in any other way modifying the points of the link or its state in general.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the link is connected to nodes at both its ends.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.Origin
member.summary: Gets or sets the origin node of the link.
member.remarks: The link's origin can be changed programmatically with this property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.Destination
member.summary: Gets or sets the destination node of this link.
member.remarks: The link's destination can be changed programmatically with this property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.OriginConnection
member.summary: Gets or sets the ConnectionPoint object representing the link connection to its origin node. This allows connecting the link to a constituent part of a node, such as a TableNode row or a TreeViewItem.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.DestinationConnection
member.summary: Gets or sets the ConnectionPoint object representing the link connection to its destination node. This allows connecting the link to a constituent part of a node, such as a TableNode row or a TreeViewItem.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.OriginIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of link's origin anchor point or table row.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.DestinationIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index of link's destination anchor point or table row.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.Dynamic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a link automatically adjusts its end points positions in order to keep pointing to the centers of nodes that it connects.
member.remarks: Use the property to specify whether a link automatically repositions its end segments, so they keep pointing to the centers of nodes connected by that link.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.RetainForm
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a link should maintain its form if the nodes connected with that link are moved around.
member.remarks: RetainForm is useful for links that have more than two control points.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.AutoRoute
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a link should avoid nodes by going the shortest path from its origin to its destination without crossing any other nodes.
member.remarks: If AutoRoute is enabled, a link automatically finds the shortest possible path between its origin and destination that doesn't intersect Obstacle nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.CascadeOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the first segment of a cascading link.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify the orientation of the first segment of a link whose Shape is set to Cascading.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.CascadeStartHorizontal
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating the orientation of the initial segment of a cascading link.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.CascadeEndHorizontal
member.summary: Gets a flag indicating the orientation of the last segment of a cascading link.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.AllowMoveStart
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is allowed to move the first control point of a link.
member.remarks: Set the property to false to prevent the link origin to be changed interactively.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.AllowMoveEnd
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user is allowed to move the end point of a link.
member.remarks: Set the property to false to prevent the link destination to be changed interactively.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.Visible
member.summary: DiagramItem.Visible override.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.DrawCrossings
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the points where this link crosses other links should be drawn as arcs or dashes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.CustomDraw
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of custom drawing performed on this link.
member.remarks: This property allows invoking custom painting code for a link.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.AutoSnapToNode

member.remarks: Use the property to get the smallest rectangle that bounds all link points.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.NewDest
member.summary: Gets the new destination of this link while the link's end point is being interactively modified.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.DiagramLink.SilentAutoRoute
member.summary: Sets the AutoRoute flag without actually performing routing or any other actions on the link.

member.summary: Adds a new item to the current selection.
member.param: The DiagramItem to be added to the selection.
member.remarks: This method adds a new item to the selection. It also deactivates the ActiveItem, if any, and makes the newly added item the active one.

member.summary: Selects an item and deselects all others.
member.param: The DiagramItem which should be made active.
member.remarks: Call this method to select an item and make it the ActiveItem. The method doesn't let you select locked items.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Selection.RemoveItem(System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Removes an item from the selection.
member.param: The UIElement to be removed from the selection.

The Header object to insert.
member.remarks: Use this method to insert Header objects at a specific position in the collection. If you do not need to specify header's position, use the Add method instead, which adds new headers to the end of the list.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Shape
member.summary: An instance of this class represents a shape defined through a series of arc, line and Bezier segments. The segments can be a part of the shape outline, in which case they define the part of the shape is filled, used for hit-testing and for aligning arrows to the node edges. Segments can also be added as decoration elements, in which case they only affect the appearance of a ShapeNode.

member.summary: Initializes the predefined static shapes.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Shape class with the specified outline.
member.param: An array of shape template elements that define the outline of a shape. Can contain lines, arcs and Bzier curves.
Specifies how areas are filled if the outline path intersects itself.

The string identifier of the new shape.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Shape.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Shape class with the specified outline.
member.param: An array containing even number of coordinate values, which define the points of the shape outline.
member.remarks: The specified array should contain even number of values. Each odd value represents the x-coordinate and each even value represents the y-coordinate of the corresponding point in the shape outline.

Specifies how areas are filled if the outline path intersects itself.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Shape.Equals(MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Shape)
member.summary: Checks whether this shape template is equivalent to the specified shape.
member.param: The shape to check for equality with the current shape.
member.returns: true if the current shape is equivalent to the specified shape; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Two shapes are considered equivalent if they have the same fill type, the same number and type of segments and if the points of those segments are close enough to each other.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Layout.FractalLayout
member.summary: A tree drawing algorithm that places child nodes symmetrically around their parent node.
member.remarks: Nodes at the lowest level are arranged directly in a circle around their parent. At the upper level, the already arranged nodes form branches that are arranged in a circle around the new parent node. The algorithm is recursively repeated till the highest level is reached.

member.summary: Maps GraphLib edges to ILink objects.

member.remarks: If Column is set to -1, the point relative coordinates specify percents of row's extents. Otherwise the point coordinates specify percents of cell's extents.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AnchorPoint.AllowIncoming
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether incoming links can be connected to this anchor.
member.remarks: If no incoming anchors are defined for a node, links end points can be placed anywhere inside that node, unless AllowUnanchoredLinks is disabled.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.AnchorPoint.AllowOutgoing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the anchor point accepts outgoing connections.
member.remarks: If no outgoing anchors are defined for a node, links start points can be placed anywhere inside that node, unless AllowUnanchoredLinks is disabled.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.GetNodeAt(System.Windows.Point,System.Double)

Allowed distance from the node.
member.returns: The DiagramNode found or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no node has been found.
member.remarks: The method searches starting from the top of z-order and returns the first object found.

member.param: A Point instance identifying a diagram location.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.GetNodeAt(System.Windows.Point,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds and returns the top-most node that lies at the specified location, optionally excluding locked and/or selected nodes from the search.

true if nodes that are locked should be omitted by searching; otherwise, false.
true if nodes that are selected should be omitted by searching; otherwise, false.
member.returns: The DiagramNode found or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no node has been found.
member.remarks: The method searches starting from the top of z-order and returns the first object found.

member.summary: Finds and returns the top-most link that lies at the specified location.
member.param: A Point instance identifying a diagram location.
The maximal distance between the point and a link, within which to consider the point as lying on the link.
member.returns: The DiagramLink found or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no item has been found.
member.remarks: Call the method to get the link at a certain place in the document. The method searches starting from the top of z-order and returns the first link found.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.GetLinkAt(System.Windows.Point,System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds and returns the top-most link that lies at the specified location, optionally excluding locked links from the search.
member.param: A Point instance identifying a diagram location.
The maximal distance between the point and a link, within which to consider the point as lying on the link.
Specifies that locked links should be ignored by the search.
member.returns: The DiagramLink found or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no item has been found.
member.remarks: Call the method to get the link at a certain place in the document. The method searches starting from the top of z-order and returns the first link found.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.GetLinkAt(System.Windows.Point,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Finds and returns the top-most link that lies at the specified location, optionally excluding locked links from the search. The zero-based index of the exact link segment at the specified position is also returned.
member.param: A Point instance identifying a diagram location.
The maximal distance between the point and a link, within which to consider the point as lying on the link.
Specifies that locked links should be ignored by the search.
The zero-based index of the link's segment at which the point is lying is returned here.
member.returns: The DiagramLink found or a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no item has been found.
member.remarks: Call the method to get the link at a certain place in the document. The method searches starting from the top of z-order and returns the first link found.

member.returns: The DiagramItem found or null (Nothing in Visual Basic) if no item has been found.
member.remarks: Call the method to get the item at a certain location in the diagram. The method searches starting from the top of z-order and returns the first item found.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.InitializeLink
member.summary: Raised when the user starts drawing a new link, just after the DiagramLink instance is created.
member.remarks: This event is raised immediately after the user starts drawing a new link.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.InitializeNode
member.summary: Raised when the user starts drawing a new node, just after the DiagramNode instance is created.
member.remarks: This event is raised immediately after the user starts drawing a new node.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkCreating
member.summary: A validation event raised while the user is drawing a new link.
member.remarks: LinkCreating is raised after each mouse movement while drawing a new link.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeCreating
member.summary: A validation event raised while the user is drawing a new node.
member.remarks: NodeCreating is raised after each mouse movement while drawing a new node.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkCreated
member.summary: Raised when the user draws a new link.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeCreated
member.summary: Occurs when the user draws a new node.

member.summary: A validation event raised while the user is modifying a link.
member.remarks: This event is raised after each mouse movement while modifying a link.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkStartModifying
member.summary: A validation event raised when the user starts modifying a link.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeModifying
member.summary: A validation event raised while the user is moving or resizing a node.
member.remarks: This event is raised after each mouse movement while modifying a node.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeStartModifying
member.summary: A validation event raised when the user starts modifying a node.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkModified
member.summary: Raised when the user moves any control point of a link.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeModified
member.summary: Raised when the user moves or resizes a node.
member.remarks: NodeModified is not raised if the node position is changed programmatically.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkClicked
member.summary: Raised when the user clicks a link.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeClicked
member.summary: Raised when the user clicks a node.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkDoubleClicked
member.summary: Raised when the user double-clicks a link.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeDoubleClicked
member.summary: Raised when the user double-clicks a node.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkSelecting
member.summary: Occurs when users try to select a link, giving you a chance to cancel the operation.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeSelecting
member.summary: Raised when the user tries to select a node, this event lets you cancel the operation.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkSelected
member.summary: Raised when a link is selected, either programmatically or by the user.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeSelected
member.summary: Raised when a node is selected, either programmatically or by the user.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkActivated
member.summary: Raised when a link becomes the ActiveItem.
member.remarks: When the event is raised, ActiveItem already refers to the activated link.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeActivated
member.summary: Raised when a node becomes the ActiveItem.
member.remarks: When this event is raised, ActiveItem already refers to the activated node.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkDeselected
member.summary: Raised when a link is deselected, either programmatically or by the user.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeDeselected
member.summary: Raised when a node is deselected, either programmatically or by the user.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkDeactivated
member.summary: Raised when a link is no longer the ActiveItem.
member.remarks: LinkDeactivated is raised when the ActiveItem changes and before that it referred to a link.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeDeactivated
member.summary: Raised when a node is no longer the ActiveItem.
member.remarks: NodeDeactivated is raised when the ActiveItem changes and before that it referred to a node.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkDeleting
member.summary: Raised when the user tries to delete a link, this event lets you cancel the operation.
member.remarks: When users delete a node, its connecting links are deleted too. However, in that case LinkDeleting validation events are not raised, but just NodeDeleting.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeDeleting
member.summary: Raised when the user tries to delete a node, this event lets you cancel the operation.
member.remarks: When the user deletes a node, the links connected to it are deleted too. However, the LinkDeleting validation event is not raised in that case.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkDeleted
member.summary: Raised when a link is deleted, either programmatically or by the user.
member.remarks: The link is removed from the Items and Links collections before the event is raised.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeDeleted
member.summary: Raised when a node is deleted, either programmatically or by the user.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ContainerChildAdded
member.summary: Raised when a node is added to a ContainerNode, either programmatically or by the user.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ContainerChildRemoved
member.summary: Raised when a node is removed from a ContainerNode, either programmatically or by the user.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.GroupDestroyed
member.summary: Raised when a Group object is destroyed.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkRouted
member.summary: Raised when a link is routed by the auto-routing algorithm.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ExpandButtonClicked
member.summary: Raised when the user clicks the [+/-] button of an Expandable node.
member.remarks: This event is raised only if ExpandButtonAction is set to RaiseEvents. Otherwise either the TreeCollapsed or TreeExpanded event is raised, depending on the state of the node.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.TreeExpanded
member.summary: Raised when a user expands a tree branch by clicking the [+] button of an Expandable node.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.TreeCollapsed
member.summary: Raised when a user collapses a tree branch by clicking the [-] button of an Expandable node.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ContainerFolded
member.summary: Raised when the user folds a container by clicking the arrow-up button in the container's caption area.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ContainerUnfolded
member.summary: Raised when the user unfolds a container by clicking the arrow-down button in the container's caption area.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DirtyChanged
member.summary: Raised when the Dirty property value has changed.
member.remarks: Dirty is set to true every time the diagram is modified, but this event is raised only if the flag value changes, either from false to true or from true to false.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DefaultShapeChanged
member.summary: Raised when the DefaultShape property value has changed.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.MeasureUnitChanged
member.summary: Raised when the MeasureUnit property value has changed.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ActionRecording
member.summary: Lets an application filter which commands are saved in the undo history.
member.remarks: A validation event raised before an action is recorded in the undo buffer.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ActionRecorded
member.summary: Occurs when an action is recorded in undo history.
member.remarks: This event is raised only for top-level commands. For example, it isn't raised for the constituent actions of a CompositeCmd.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ActionUndone
member.summary: Raised when an action is undone.
member.remarks: This event is raised during calls to Undo. It is raised both for top-level commands and for the constituent actions of composite commands.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ActionRedone
member.summary: Raised when an action is redone.
member.remarks: This event is raised during calls to Redo. It is raised both for top-level commands and for the constituent actions of composite commands.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ValidateAnchorPoint
member.summary: A validation event that lets you approve or reject connecting a link to an anchor point.
member.remarks: This event is raised for each point of an AnchorPattern while a link's end point is being moved over a node.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DestinationAnchorChanged
member.summary: Raised when the DestinationAnchor property value of a link has changed.
member.remarks: This event is raised every time the DestinationAnchor property of a link changes, either because a user connects the link end to a different anchor point, or because an application sets it programmatically.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.OriginAnchorChanged
member.summary: Raised when the OriginAnchor property value of a link has changed.
member.remarks: This event is raised every time the OriginAnchor property of a link changes, either because an user connects the link end to a different anchor point, or because an application sets it programmatically.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DrawLink
member.summary: Raised when a diagram link must be custom drawn.
member.remarks: This event is raised for links whose CustomDraw property is enabled.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DrawNode
member.summary: Raised when a diagram node must be custom drawn.
member.remarks: This event is raised for links whose CustomDraw property is enabled.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DrawAnchorPoint
member.summary: Raised when an anchor point must be custom drawn.
member.remarks: DrawAnchorPoint is raised for an AnchorPoint if the point's MarkStyle is set to Custom.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DrawAdjustmentHandles
member.summary: Raised when item's adjustment handles must be custom drawn.
member.remarks: DrawAdjustmentHandles is raised for selected items whose HandlesStyle is set to Custom.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DrawLaneHeader
member.summary: Raised when a grid lane's header must be custom drawn.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DrawCell
member.summary: Raised when a table's cell must be custom drawn.
member.remarks: This event is raised for tables whose CellCustomDraw property is enabled.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkTextEditing
member.summary: A validation event that lets you approve or reject changes made to the text of a link.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeTextEditing
member.summary: A validation event that lets you approve or reject changes made to the text of a node.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.CellTextEditing
member.summary: A validation event that lets you prevent users from editing the text of a table's cell.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.TreeItemTextEditing
member.summary: A validation event that lets you approve or reject changes made to the text of a TreeViewNode's item.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LaneGridHeaderTextEditing
member.summary: A validation event that lets you approve or reject changes made to the text of a lane grid header.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkTextEdited
member.summary: Raised when the user edits the text of a link.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodeTextEdited
member.summary: Raised when the user edits the text of a node.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.CellTextEdited
member.summary: Raised when the user edits the text of a table's cell.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LaneGridHeaderTextEdited
member.summary: Raised when the user edits the text of a lane grid header.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.HitTestAdjustmentHandles
member.summary: Raised when custom hit testing of item's adjustment handles must be performed.
member.remarks: For links, set the result to the index of the link's control point that has been hit. For nodes, set the result to 0, 1, 2, 3 for the corner resize handles, 4, 5, 6, 7 for the side center resize handles, 8 for the move handle and 9 for the rotation handle.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.Clicked
member.summary: Raised when the user clicks the diagram at a point where no items are located.
member.remarks: This event is raised only if the user clicks an unoccupied point of the diagram. If the user clicks a diagram item, one of the following events is raised: NodeClicked, CellClicked or LinkClicked.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DoubleClicked
member.summary: Raised when the user double-clicks the diagram at a point where no items are located.
member.remarks: This event is raised only if the user double-clicks an unoccupied point of the diagram. If the user double-clicks a diagram item, one of the following events is raised: NodeDoubleClicked, CellDoubleClicked or LinkDoubleClicked.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.BoundsChanged
member.summary: Raised when the Bounds property value has changed.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.SelectionMoved
member.summary: Raised when the user moves multiple selected items.
member.remarks: Use the Nodes and Links properties of the diagram's Selection to find out which items have been moved.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.SelectionMoving
member.summary: Raised while the user is moving multiple selected items, this event lets you cancel the modification.
member.remarks: This event is raised after each mouse movement while modifying a selection of items.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.SelectionChanged
member.summary: Raised when an item is added to or removed from the selection.
member.remarks: Use the Nodes and Links properties of the diagram's Selection to find out which items are currently selected.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.CellClicked
member.summary: Raised when the user clicks a table's cell.
member.remarks: If there is some handler attached to this event, NodeClicked won't be raised for the table that contains the clicked cell, but only CellClicked.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.CellDoubleClicked
member.summary: Raised when the user double-clicks a table's cell.
member.remarks: If there is some handler attached to this event, NodeDoubleClicked won't be raised for the table that contains the clicked cell, but only CellDoubleClicked.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.TableSectionExpanded
member.summary: Raised when the user expands the rows of a table's section by clicking the [+] button in the section's header row.
member.remarks: A header row is a row whose Header property is enabled.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.TableSectionCollapsed
member.summary: Raised when the user collapses the rows of a table's section by clicking the [-] button in the section's header row.
member.remarks: A header row is a row whose Header property is enabled.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkPasted
member.summary: Raised when a link has been pasted from the clipboard.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NodePasted
member.summary: Raised when a node has been pasted from the clipboard.

member.summary: Raised when an item is added to the diagram, either programmatically or interactively.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ItemRemoved
member.summary: Raised when an item is removed from the diagram, either programmatically or interactively.

member.summary: Raised when the component starts loading diagram data from a file or memory stream.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.EndLoad
member.summary: Raised when the component ends loading diagram data from a file or memory stream.

member.summary: Raised when the Tag of a diagram item must be serialized into an XML document.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DeserializeTag
member.summary: Raised when the Tag of a diagram item must be deserialized from XML format.
member.remarks: Only tags of simple value types can be saved and loaded automatically to/from the XML document. You must provide your own serialization for complex types by implementing this event and SerializeTag.

member.summary: Raised when a DiagramNodeAdapter is cloned. Use this event to copy the hosted control's properties.

member.summary: Raised when entering inplace-edit mode.

member.name: E:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LeaveInplaceEditMode
member.summary: Raised when leaving inplace-edit mode.

member.summary: Occurs when the zoom factor changes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.EnableLanes
member.summary: Gets or sets whether lanes are enabled.
member.remarks: You can customize the lane grid through the LaneGrid property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.Interaction
member.summary: Gets an InteractionState instance representing the current action being carried out by the user.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.IsModifying
member.summary: Gets a value specifying whether the diagram is currently being modified by the user.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.Items
member.summary: Gets a collection of all items in this diagram.
member.remarks: This collection gives you access to all items contained in this document. You can also use it to add new items to the diagram.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.Nodes
member.summary: Gets a collection of all DiagramNode objects in the diagram.
member.remarks: Nodes provides type-safe access to all nodes in the current diagram. Any diagram element can be accessed also by using the Items collection.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.Links
member.summary: Gets a collection of all DiagramLink objects in the diagram.
member.remarks: Links provides type-safe access to all links in the current diagram. Any diagram element can be accessed also via the Items collection.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.Groups
member.summary: Gets a collection of all groups in the diagram.
member.remarks: Groups provides access to all groups defined in the current diagram.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.Selection
member.summary: Gets a Selection instance that represents the selection of items in this diagram.
member.remarks: Use this property to get the items currently selected by a user. Items can be enumerated by the Items member of the Selection class.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ActiveItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the active diagram element.
member.remarks: Use this property to get the active item - the one selected by the user or the last put in a multiple Selection.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.Dirty
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the diagram has changed since the last save.
member.remarks: WpfDiagram tracks all changes that are done on the diagram contents, either programmatically or by users. If there are changes that are still not saved, the property has value of true.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ValidityChecks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether validity checks are performed each time an item is added to the diagram.
member.remarks: If enabled, validity checks are performed each time an item is added to the diagram. That involves enumerating the Items collection and can slow up the process considerably for large diagrams. You can disable this property in order to skip the validity checks, however be sure that you don't add an item twice to the diagram and that links are created only between items in the same diagram.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DocumentPlane
member.summary: DocumentPlane is visual child of diagram and ancestor of all diagram items. The DocumentPlane element is translated with respect to Diagram element so that the point Diagram.Bounds.TopLeft from the DocumentPlane is rendered at Diagram element location (0,0) The coordinate system of the DocumentPlane is the document coordinate system. The intended use of this property is mainly in MouseMove event handling

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.MeasureUnit
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of measure used for logical coordinates in this diagram.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.SortGroupsByZ
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether grouped items should be drawn sorted by their z-order while the whole group is being moved.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NowPrinting
member.summary: Gets a flag indicating whether the diagram is currently being printed.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.RenderOptions
member.summary: Gets the current rendering options for this Diagram.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.AdjustmentHandlesSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the handles, which appear around selected objects.
member.remarks: Use the property to set the size of the manipulation handles, which appear around selected items.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.SelectionOnTop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether selected items should be painted on top of other items.
member.remarks: If SelectionOnTop is enabled, selected items are painted over non-selected ones, ignoring the z-order position specified in ZIndex.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ShowAnchors
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether and when node anchor points should be displayed.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.BackBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush used for painting the diagram background.
member.remarks: This property enables more spectacular background painting with effects such as gradients, textures and color patterns.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ExpandButtonPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets where expand/collapse buttons are located relatively to their nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkCrossings
member.summary: Gets or sets how to render the intersection points where links cross their paths.
member.remarks: Intersection points where links cross each other's paths can be rendered as arcs or breaks, depending on the value of this property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.CrossingRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the radius length of decorations displayed at link intersection points.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.RoundRectFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative size of arcs displayed at the corners of rounded rectangles.
member.remarks: This property lets you increase or decrease that value by multiplying it by the specified factor.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ShowHandlesOnDrag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to display selection handles of objects under the mouse while another object is being modified.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.RoundedLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the joins between segments of Polyline and Cascading links should be rounded.
member.remarks: The value of this property is considered when drawing links whose Shape is set to Polyline or Cascading.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.RoundedLinksRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the radius of arc joins of rounded links' segments.
member.remarks: The value of this property is used when RoundedLinks is enabled. It specifies the radius of the arcs drawn as joins between link segments.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.BackgroundImage
member.summary: Gets or sets the image displayed as background of this diagram.
member.remarks: This image is painted as a background of the diagram, behind the alignment grid and all items.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.BackgroundImageAlign
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how the background image is positioned, relatively either to the control's window or to the scrollable document area.
member.remarks: The background image can be aligned to a corner, stretched, centered, or tiled to cover the control's area.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ActiveItemHandlesStyle
member.summary: Gets the visual style of adjustment handles of the active item.
member.remarks: Use the property to specify the color in which the manipulation handles that appear around the active item are painted.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.SelectedItemHandlesStyle
member.summary: Gets the visual style of adjustment handles of selected items.
member.remarks: This style object provides Pen and Brush attributes that let you customize the appearance of adjustment handles drawn around selected items.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DisabledHandlesStyle
member.summary: Gets the visual style of disabled adjustment handles.
member.remarks: This style object provides Pen and Brush attributes that let you customize the appearance of disabled adjustment handles.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ShowDisabledHandles
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether manipulation handles are painted when they are disabled.
member.remarks: Individual handles can be disabled or enabled by clearing or setting their correspondent bits in node's EnabledHandles.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.SelectAfterCreate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether newly created objects are automatically selected.
member.remarks: Use the property to specify if the items that are drawn are selecting, which allows immediate modification actions to be performed over them.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.RestrictItemsToBounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether users are allowed to place items outside the scrollable area of the diagram.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify whether diagram elements can be drawn or moved outside the document area.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.HitTestPriority
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the order in which items are hit-tested.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ExpandOnIncoming
member.summary: Gets or sets a value, indicating in which direction object hierarchies are expanded.
member.remarks: Use this property when presenting tree structures with enabled collapse/expand.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.RecursiveExpand
member.summary: Gets or sets value indicating how a tree is expanded.
member.remarks: Use the property when representing tree structures, which hide some of their elements.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.AllowLinksRepeat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether more than one link can connect the same origin and destination diagram nodes.
member.remarks: Specifies whether more than one link can connect the same origin and destination diagram nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.SnapToAnchor
member.summary: Gets or sets when arrow end points should be aligned to the nearest anchor points.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.AllowUnconnectedLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether users are allowed to draw links that are not connected to any node.
member.remarks: If the property is set to true, users will be able to draw links from or to any point of the document.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.AllowUnanchoredLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether links can be connected to nodes to which there aren't anchor points assigned.
member.remarks: AllowUnanchoredLinks applies to nodes whose AnchorPattern is not set or does not contain incoming or outgoing anchor points available.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.MinimumNodeSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum node size that the user is allowed to set.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.AutoResize
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the document area should be resized automatically so it fits the diagram contents.
member.remarks: If automatic resizing is enabled, the size of the document scrollable area is updated each time an item is created, deleted or moved, either by end-users or via method calls.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkEndsMovable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether arrow ends can be moved by users after the link is created.
member.remarks: When the property is set to true, users cannot move the ends of a link after the link is created.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.AllowSplitLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether link segments can be added and removed interactively.
member.remarks: Lets users insert new link segments interactively by clicking and dragging a point of a link's segment.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.AllowSelfLoops
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether self-loops are allowed.
member.remarks: Use the property to specify whether the user is allowed to draw self loops - links that connect a node to itself.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.RouteLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether links should avoid nodes by going the shortest path from their origin to their destination without crossing any other nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.RoutingOptions
member.summary: Gets an object, which allows customizing various parameters of the link routing algorithm.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.RoutingGrid
member.summary: Gets a RoutingGrid instance used to allocate grid arrays.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkRouter
member.summary: Gets or sets the component used to find paths for auto-routed links when diagram nodes are added or their positions change.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DontRouteForAwhile
member.summary: Gets or sets whether arrow routing is enabled.
member.remarks: Used to disable routing during load time and when automatic layout routines run.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ExpandButtonAction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating what should happen when a user clicks the [+/-] button that is displayed near expandable nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.Content
member.summary: Allows creating diagram items thorugh XAML.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.MergeThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum distance between adjacent control points of a link at which the respective segments can be merged.
member.remarks: An user may add or remove links' segments interactively when the AllowSplitLinks property is enabled.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.AlignToGrid
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the diagram items should be aligned to a grid.
member.remarks: When the property is set to true, the sides of every newly created diagram item are aligned to the nearest grid points.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ShowGrid
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the alignment grid is visible.
member.remarks: If it is visible, the grid is painted as either a matrix of points or crossing horizontal and vertical lines. That depends on the value of GridStyle.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.GridPen
member.summary: Gets or sets the Pen/Brush of the grid lines/points.
member.remarks: Use the property to specify the Pen/Brush of grid lines and points.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.GridSizeX
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal distance between adjacent grid points.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.GridSizeY
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical distance between adjacent grid points.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.GridOffsetX
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal offset of the first point of the alignment grid.
member.remarks: The property specifies the offset of the first point of the alignment grid.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.GridOffsetY
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical offset of the first point of the alignment grid.
member.remarks: The property specifies the offset of the first point of the alignment grid.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.GridStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual style of the alignment grid.
member.remarks: Specifies how the alignment grid is drawn.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.Bounds
member.summary: Gets or sets a value representing the size of the diagram's scrollable area.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify how large a document should be, that is, how far it can be scrolled.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ScriptHelper
member.summary: Gets a ScriptHelper object which can be used in html scripts to instantiate various objects and to call static methods.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.UndoManager
member.summary: Gets a reference to the diagram's UndoManager instance.
member.remarks: Use this property to control the undo manager operations, Undo or Redo commands, and access the command History.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.IsTrialVersion
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the currently loaded WpfDiagram is a trial version of the control.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.IsProEdition
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the currently loaded WpfDiagram is a professional version of the control.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DisabledGroups
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether grouping functionality is currently disabled in this Diagram.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.NowLoading
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the diagram data is now being loaded from a file.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.MindFusion#Diagramming#Wpf#IItemFactory#TypeTable
member.summary: Gets the table with registered classes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.MindFusion#Diagramming#Wpf#IItemFactory#ClsidTable
member.summary: Gets the table with registered classes.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying how far from a link a click is still considered a hit.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.RowHighlightBrush
member.summary: Gets or sets the Brush used to fill highlighted table rows.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.AutoHighlightRows
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a table row should be highlighted when the user clicks on it.

member.summary: Gets or sets the default value for the HandlesStyle property of new DiagramNodeAdapter nodes.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of the controls that will be hosted by default in newly created DiagramNodeAdapter objects.

Gets or sets the ways mouse clicks are handled by default in the controls hosted in ControlHost objects.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the default font for new diagram items.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.TableRowCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the default number of table rows.
member.remarks: Use the property to set the initial number of rows for newly created tables.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.TableColumnCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the default number of table columns.
member.remarks: This value is used to initialize the ColumnCount property of new tables.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.ShapeCustomDraw
member.summary: Gets or sets the default type of custom painting done for shape nodes.
member.remarks: This property specifies whether and how custom painting of shape nodes is performed. Its value is assigned to the CustomDraw property of new shape nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.TableCustomDraw
member.summary: Gets or sets the default type of custom painting done on tables.
member.remarks: The CustomDraw member of tables is initialized from this property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.CellCustomDraw
member.summary: Gets or sets the default type of custom painting done on the cells of tables.
member.remarks: The CellCustomDraw member of new tables is initialized from this property.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkCustomDraw
member.summary: Gets or sets the default type of custom painting done on links.
member.remarks: This property specifies whether and how custom painting of links is performed.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.DynamicLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets the default value for the Dynamic property of new links.
member.remarks: Use the property to specify whether links automatically reposition their end segments, so they keep pointing to the centers of connected nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.AutoSnapLinks
member.summary: Gets or sets the default value for the SnapToNodeBorder property of new links.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.AutoSnapDistance
member.summary: Specifies the maximum distance at which links auto-snap to nodes.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinksRetainForm
member.summary: Gets or sets whether links should maintain their forms if the nodes linked with those links are moved around.
member.remarks: LinksRetainForm value is used to initialize the RetainForm property of new links.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.TableColumnWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the default width of tables' columns.
member.remarks: This property is used to initialize the ColumnWidth property of new tables.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.TableRowHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the default height of tables' rows.
member.remarks: TableRowHeight is used to initialize the RowHeight property of new tables.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.TableCaptionHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the default height of table captions.
member.remarks: The value of this property is used to initialize the CaptionHeight property of new tables.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.TableConnectionStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether drawing an arrow between tables should link rows of those tables, or the tables as whole entities.
member.remarks: The value of TableConnectionStyle is used to initialize the ConnectionStyle property of new tables.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.LinkCascadeOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the initial orientation of the first segment of new cascading links.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify the default orientation of the first segment of DiagramLink objects whose Shape is set to LinkShape.Cascading.

member.name: P:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram.CellFrameStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the default cell border style of new tables.
member.remarks: Use this property to specify the default border style of cells in new tables. See CellFrameStyle enumeration for more details.

The y-coordinate of the upper left corner of the ellipse's bounding rectangle.
The width of the ellipse's bounding rectangle.
The height of the ellipse's bounding rectangle.
The clockwise angle, in degrees, between the horizontal axis of the ellipse and the starting point of the arc.
The clockwise angle, in degrees, between the starting point and the ending point of the arc.

The width of the ellipse's bounding rectangle.
The height of the ellipse's bounding rectangle.
The clockwise angle, in degrees, between the horizontal axis of the ellipse and the starting point of the arc.
The clockwise angle, in degrees, between the starting point and the ending point of the arc.
The color of this segment.
The dash style of this segment.
The width of this segment.
member.remarks: An arc template is defined by an ellipse and starting and sweeping angles.

member.name: T:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.UndoManager
member.summary: Implements undo/redo functionality in WpfDiagram.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.UndoManager.#ctor(MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.Diagram)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the UndoManager class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.UndoManager.Undo
member.summary: Undoes an action saved in the command history.
member.remarks: Undoes a command from the command history. The action that would be undone by calling this method is pointed by NextUndo property of the CommandHistory class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.UndoManager.Redo
member.summary: Executes again an action saved in the command history.
member.remarks: Executes again a command from the command history. The action that would be redone by calling this method is pointed by NextRedo property of the CommandHistory class.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.UndoManager.StartComposite(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an 'active' composite record with the specified title.
member.param: A string to be associated with the composite record. It can be used later to give more information to users what exactly will be undone or redone. Use the Title property of the command class to get the title of an action record.
member.returns: An instance of the CompositeCmd class which represents the active composite record. Call its Execute method when done with recording actions in the composite.

member.name: M:MindFusion.Diagramming.Wpf.UndoManager.StartComposite(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an 'active' composite record with the specified settings.
member.param: A string to be associated with the composite record. It can be used later to give more information to users what exactly will be undone or redone. Use the Title property of the command class to get the title of an action record.

Set this parameter to true to save the whole z-order array before executing the composite command, and to restore it back when the command is undone. Use that when there will be create or delete commands added to the composite one, because they do not guarantee restoring the items in the same z-order when the commands are undone or redone.
member.returns: An instance of the CompositeCmd class which represents the active composite record. Call its Execute method when done with recording actions in the composite.

member.summary: Enables or disables the undo manager without clearing the underlying command history.
